2:Ta12,{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"FAQPage","mainEntity":[{"@type":"Question","name":"Do Uruguayans need a passport to enter Argentina?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"No! Uruguayans can enter Argentina using just their cÃ©dula de identidad (national ID card). This is one of the unique benefits of Mercosur freedom of movement. A passport is optional but not required."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"How long does it take to get residency?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"The same day you apply, you receive a 'precaria' (temporary receipt) that makes you legal. Your actual residency card (DNI extranjero) is ready within 2-4 weeks. No other nationality gets residency this fast."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Can I work immediately?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Yes! From the moment you apply for Mercosur residency, you have full work authorization. You can even start working while waiting for your appointment at migraciones."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Do I need to show income or job to get residency?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"The requirements are very flexible. You need to show 'means of support' but this can be a job offer, bank statements, or even a declaration. Many Uruguayans get residency without formal employment."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Can I live in Argentina but work in Uruguay?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Absolutely! This is very common. Many Uruguayans live in Buenos Aires (lower cost of living) but maintain jobs in Montevideo, or work remotely for Uruguayan companies. The border is open and crossing is easy."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Will I lose my Uruguayan citizenship?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"No. Argentina and Uruguay both allow dual citizenship. You can become Argentine without losing your Uruguayan nationality. In fact, many Uruguayans hold both passports."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Is healthcare available?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Yes. With Mercosur residency, you can access the public healthcare system (free) or purchase private health insurance (prepaga) just like Argentine citizens."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"What's the difference between living in Montevideo vs Buenos Aires?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Buenos Aires is much larger (3x the population), has more job opportunities, better nightlife, and lower cost of living. Montevideo is safer, more stable economically, and quieter. Many Uruguayans choose BA for career growth but miss Montevideo's tranquility."}}]}0:{"buildId":"XJ7f5RvYDcX4yjbAXmNYG","rsc":["$","$1","c",{"children":[[["$","script",null,{"type":"application/ld+json","dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"$2"}}],["$","script",null,{"type":"application/ld+json","dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"{\"@context\":\"https://schema.org\",\"@type\":\"BreadcrumbList\",\"itemListElement\":[{\"@type\":\"ListItem\",\"position\":1,\"name\":\"Home\",\"item\":\"https://expatsargentina.com\"},{\"@type\":\"ListItem\",\"position\":2,\"name\":\"Nationalities\",\"item\":\"https://expatsargentina.com/nationality\"},{\"@type\":\"ListItem\",\"position\":3,\"name\":\"Uruguay\"}]}"}}],["$","div",null,{"className":"min-h-screen","children":[["$","section",null,{"className":"bg-gradient-to-b from-primary/10 to-background py-12 md:py-16","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"container px-4 md:px-6","children":["$L3","$L4"]}]}],"$L5","$L6"]}]],null,"$L7"]}],"loading":null,"isPartial":false}
